value.title: Architect migration, business continuity, and disaster recovery in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to migrate resources to Azure, how to provide site recovery for your applications in Azure and on-premises, and how to your applications are available through service interruptions and changes in load.

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Site Recovery and Azure Database Migration Service.

images.title: Design your migration to Azure

topItems.title: Protect your on-premises infrastructure from disasters with Azure Site Recovery
topItems.excerpt: Provide disaster recovery for your on-premises infrastructure by managing and orchestrating replication, failover, and failback of VMware virtual machines, Hyper-V virtual machines, and physical servers with Azure Site Recovery.

images.title: Protect your on-premises infrastructure from disasters with Azure Site Recovery

topItems.title: Protect your Azure infrastructure with Azure Site Recovery
topItems.excerpt: Provide disaster recovery for your Azure infrastructure by managing and orchestrating replication, failover, and failback of Azure virtual machines with Azure Site Recovery.

images.title: Protect your Azure infrastructure with Azure Site Recovery

topItems.title: Protect your virtual machines by using Azure Backup
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Backup to help protect the data for on-premises servers, virtual machines, virtualized workloads, SQL Server, Azure Files, and more.

images.title: Protect your virtual machines by using Azure Backup
Design your migration to Azure

value.title: AZ-400: Manage source control
value.excerpt:
Learn how GitHub enables you to build a modern source control strategy that fosters collaboration and enables you to automate your build and deployment processes.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

images.title: Introduction to GitHub

topItems.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

images.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices

topItems.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

images.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices

topItems.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

images.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
Introduction to GitHub

value.title: Learn the business value of Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt:
Are you interested in learning about the cloud in an easy to understand way? Or perhaps you are confused about where to begin with cloud technology?
This learning experience will take you on  a journey that will begin by showing you how digital transformation and the power of the cloud can transform your business. We will cover how Microsoft Azure cloud services can power your organization on a trusted cloud platform. Finally, we will wrap up by illustrating how to make this journey real for your organization.
In this learning path, you will learn about:

Enabling digital transformation.
Identifying ways to migrate and modernize applications.
Gaining insights through data, artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT)
Meeting a broad set of regulatory and compliance standards on a trusted cloud platform.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure solutions
topItems.excerpt: Begin digital transformation by exploring why Azure is the right platform for your organization and the value Azure can bring. See how Azure enables you to empower employees, engage customers, optimize operations, and transform products.

images.title: Introduction to Azure solutions

topItems.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Every modern business is powered by applications, such as internal procurement applications, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, retail websites, and third-party products. As your business prepares for digital transformation, it’s important to begin modernizing and migrating your applications and infrastructure to the cloud. Azure is a key component of that process. You can choose to migrate, modernize, or build cloud native solutions depending on your business goals and how you assess your application portfolio. This is a strategic decision. You’ll be able to choose the path that’s right for your organization.

images.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization

topItems.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Establishing a modern data estate is a foundational step toward digital transformation. A modern data estate enables timely insights and decision making across all your data, and sets the foundation for AI. A data estate is all of the data an organization owns. When you migrate this data to the cloud or modernize your environment on-premises you can gain important insights to fuel innovation.

images.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure AI and demonstrates how Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure can help make AI real for your organization, whether you want to unlock insights from your latent data with knowledge mining, develop your own AI models with machine learning, or build immersive apps using AI.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
Introduction to Azure solutions

value.title: Protect identity and access with Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: The **Identity and Access learning path** covers the latest identity and access technologies, tools for strengthening authentication, and guidance on identity protection within your organization. Microsoft access and identity technologies enable you to secure your organization’s identity, whether it is on-premises or in the cloud, and empower your users to work securely from any location.

topItems.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how identity and access management work in Microsoft 365.

images.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365

topItems.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Microsoft 365 authentication tools for access and identity provisioning.

images.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Microsoft 365

topItems.title: Strengthen authentication with Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to strengthen authentication across your enterprise deployment with security tools from Microsoft 365.

images.title: Strengthen authentication with Microsoft 365

topItems.title: Secure administrator accounts in Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn about securing administrator accounts through secure devices, dedicated administrator accounts, and just-in-time privileges.

images.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365

value.title: Protect identity and access with Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Identity & access management is the foundation for a secure digital estate. The credentials that you issue to your users prove that they are who they claim to be and that they have permission to access your resources. Learn how to use Microsoft 365 to for authentication and authorization in your enterprise environment.

topItems.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how identity and access management work in Microsoft 365.

images.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365

topItems.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Microsoft 365 authentication tools for access and identity provisioning.

images.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Microsoft 365

topItems.title: Strengthen authentication with Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to strengthen authentication across your enterprise deployment with security tools from Microsoft 365.

images.title: Strengthen authentication with Microsoft 365

topItems.title: Secure administrator accounts in Microsoft 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn about securing administrator accounts through secure devices, dedicated administrator accounts, and just-in-time privileges.

images.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365

value.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure supports three approaches to deploying cloud resources - public, private, and the hybrid cloud. Selecting between them will change several factors of the services you move into Azure including cost, maintenance requirements, and security. In this module, we will look at all three types and help you make an informed decision about which one to leverage for your services. We'll also quickly look at the service models supported by Azure which can help you determine the services you should start with when planning out an Azure deployment.

images.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure

value.title: Explore DevOps Continuous Security and Continuous Operations
value.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Security and Continuous Operations.

images.title: Explore DevOps Continuous Security and Continuous Operations

value.title: Automate your workflow with GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn how GitHub Actions enables you to automate your software development cycle and deploy applications to Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

images.title: Introduction to GitHub

topItems.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

images.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions

topItems.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create workflows that enable you to use Continuous Integration (CI) for your projects.

images.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions

topItems.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create two deployment workflows using GitHub Actions and Microsoft Azure.

images.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
Introduction to GitHub

value.title: Build automated workflows to integrate data and apps with Azure Logic Apps
value.excerpt: Azure Logic Apps is a cloud service that automates the execution of your business processes. Learn how to leverage logic apps to create serverless workflows that run automatically when data is available.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Characterize the types of business processes that Logic Apps can automate. Describe the function of connectors, triggers, and actions and show how you combine them to create an app.

images.title: Introduction to Azure Logic Apps

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Define a workflow using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators. Your workflow will run automatically when data is available, process the data in the cloud, record results in a database, and send email notifications.

images.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps

topItems.title: Call an API from a Logic Apps workflow using a custom connector
topItems.excerpt: Call any Web API from a Logic App using the custom connector.

images.title: Call an API from a Logic Apps workflow using a custom connector

topItems.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
topItems.excerpt: Define a Logic Apps workflow declaratively as a Resource Manager template and deploy the app using the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI).

images.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
Introduction to Azure Logic Apps

value.title: Deploy applications with Azure DevOps learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous delivery (CD) pipeline that automates the process of deploying your application.

images.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Design and create a realistic release pipeline that promotes changes to various testing and staging environments.

images.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

images.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

images.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Connect your on-premises network to the Microsoft global network by using ExpressRoute
value.excerpt: Connect your on-premises systems and users to Azure and Office 365 by using ExpressRoute for private, dedicated, and guaranteed throughput connectivity.

images.title: Connect your on-premises network to the Microsoft global network by using ExpressRoute

value.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

images.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use RBAC to manage access to resources in Azure.

images.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)

value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.title: AI edge engineer
value.excerpt: The AI edge engineer learning path takes an engineering-led approach for the deployment of AI to edge devices within the framework of the cloud. This learning path helps the participants to learn skills in AI (broadly covering machine learning and deep learning algorithms), IoT and DevOps.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: Explain the significance of Azure IoT and the problems it solves. Describe Azure IoT components and explain how you combine them to solve IoT solutions, which create value for enterprises.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Assess the characteristics of Azure IoT Hub and determine scenarios when to use IoT Hub.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

topItems.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: Deploy a pre-built temperature simulator module to the edge using a container. The pre-built module will be deployed to an IoT edge device. You will check that the module was successfully created and deployed to the edge. You will view the simulated data from the deployed module.

images.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
Introduction to Azure IoT

value.title: Build JavaScript applications with Node.js
value.excerpt: Node.js provides a large set of built-in APIs that help you build various types of applications, command-line apps, web apps, and more. It also offers testing and debugging capabilities and a rich ecosystem of third-party packages that you can easily add to your application.

topItems.title: Introduction to Node.js
topItems.excerpt: Learn everything about Node.js: what it is, how does it work and when to use it.

topItems.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
topItems.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project.

topItems.title: Interactively debug Node.js apps with the built-in and Visual Studio Code debuggers
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to efficiently debug your Node.js app using Visual Studio Code to fix your bugs quickly.

topItems.title: Work with files and directories in a Node.js app
topItems.excerpt: Build an app that manipulates files and directories with Node.js.

value.title: Data engineering with Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Learn how to harness the power of Apache Spark and powerful clusters running on the Azure Databricks platform to run large data engineering workloads in the cloud.

topItems.title: Describe Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: Understand the architecture of an Azure Databricks Spark Cluster and Spark Jobs.

images.title: Spark architecture fundamentals

topItems.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Work with large amounts of data from multiple sources in different raw formats. Azure Databricks supports day-to-day data-handling functions, such as reads, writes, and queries.

images.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Your data processing in Azure Databricks is accomplished by defining DataFrames to read and process the Data. Learn how to perform data transformations in DataFrames and execute actions to display the transformed data.

images.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
Describe Azure Databricks

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?
In this learning path, you will:

Get an overview of virtualization technology and how it is used in the cloud
Learn a formal definition of virtualization and its different types
Understand how CPUs are virtualized
Understand how memory is virtualized
Understand how I/O is virtualized
Understand how storage and networking is virtualized

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
value.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

images.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions

value.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers
value.excerpt: A trigger is responsible for executing an Azure function and there are dozens of triggers to choose from. This module will you show you some of the most common types of triggers and how to configure them to execute your logic.

images.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers

value.title: Introduction to Docker containers
value.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

value.title: Manage access to an Azure subscription by using Azure role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: To grant access to a subscription, identify the appropriate role to assign to an employee. Understand when you might need to temporarily elevate your own access to regain access to a subscription.

value.title: AI business school for education
value.excerpt: Decision-makers in education have considerations that are particular to their sector to help them realize the true transformational impact of AI in education. It is critical to understand the components of a strategy that will help the education sector create value with AI. This learning path is designed for education decision-makers to illustrate the true transformational impact of AI in education.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: AI has the capacity to empower the whole world to achieve more. From empowering technical development teams to mobilizing an entire organization to unlock the true potential of AI, enterprises need to think strategically about AI – and they need to start today.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in education
topItems.excerpt: In education, decision-makers must take into account specific industry considerations before they can realize the true transformational power of AI. Educational institutions and organizations need to think strategically about AI—and they need to start today. To create real value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in education

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: A successful AI strategy must consider cultural issues as well as business issues. Becoming an AI-ready organization requires a fundamental transformation in how you do things, how employees relate to each other, what skills they have, and what processes and principles guide your behaviors. This unit is designed to help you understand which are the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and proposes a framework to drive that change in your organization.

images.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: This module is designed for finance and affiliated business decision-makers to illustrate the impact of making strategic decisions with AI. The goal is to enable you to think about AI transformation holistically, with a focus on the cultural changes necessary to make AI transformation successful.

images.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
Define an AI strategy to create business value

value.title: AI business school for government

It's critical to understand the components of a strategy that will help the public sector create value with AI. This learning path is designed for government decision-makers to illustrate the true transformational impact of AI in the public sector.
